If a control function \\( v(x,t) \\) is applied at time \\( t_1 \\), modifying the equation to \\( \\frac{\\partial u}{\\partial t} = L(u) + v \\), will the Fourier transform of \\( u(x,T) \\) for \\( T > t_1 \\) depend solely on the initial condition \\( u(x,0) \\) and not on \\( v \\)?
Explanation: The intervention with \\( v(x,t) \\) changes the trajectory of \\( u \\), hence the Fourier transform of \\( u(x,T) \\) will depend not only on the initial state but also on the nature and effect of \\( v \\). The resultant state is influenced significantly by how \\( v \\) interacts with the system dynamics dictated by \\( L \\).
